channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 6% of Your Paycheck Is Becoming the New Standard for 401(k) Saving
item.description: Workers are putting a record share of their income toward retirement. Employers’ automatic savings plans help explain why.

item.title: ‘My mother is being catfished’: She fell ‘madly in love’ with a man over Facebook. How do I convince her that it’s a scam?
item.description: “My sister and I found loads of evidence online that this is a fake account. There are actually numerous fake accounts on various platforms that use t...

item.title: Crypto Platforms to Report Tax Information to IRS Starting in 2026
item.description: In a long-awaited step against tax evasion in cryptocurrency markets, the Treasury Department adopted a final rule requiring many crypto platforms to ...

item.title: How can we tap the equity in our home without paying a 7% interest rate? We currently have a mortgage rate of less than 4%.
item.description: “Should I accept that 7%-plus interest rate is the starting rate these days?”

item.title: Big Banks Boost Dividends After Passing Stress Tests
item.description: Goldman, Morgan Stanley and others detailed their capital plans on Friday.

item.title: ‘In a worst-case scenario, we fear a stock-market bust’: We are ‘healthy boomers’ in our 60s with a net worth of $4.2 million. Is it time to diversify?
item.description: “We have no debt and live comfortably on $150,000 per year.”

item.title: The Score: Rivian, Amazon, Trump Media and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: ‘Our children have varying degrees of success’: My husband and I are in our 80s and have $300,000 to leave our 3 children. Do we give more to our underemployed son?
item.description: “At 56, he has few prospects for his future.”

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
item.description: Read about our columnists’ favorite and least-favorite stocks and see how they have performed.

item.title: Is golf an elitist sport? Biden and Trump argue over their golf handicaps during their first 2024 presidential debate.
item.description: Just 22% of golfers are people of color and 42% have household incomes of $100,000-plus, according to the National Golf Foundation.
